trans-unit.source: Represents the method that handles the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event of a <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule"></xref>.
trans-unit.target: Rappresenta il metodo che gestisce il **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** evento di un <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule"> </xref>.

trans-unit.source: The WindowsAuthenticationEventHandler delegate is defined for the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> class.
trans-unit.target: Il delegato WindowsAuthenticationEventHandler è definito per l' <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate>evento della <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule>classe.</xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate>

trans-unit.source: You can access the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> class by specifying a subroutine named **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application.
trans-unit.target: È possibile accedere il <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate>evento del <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule>classe specificando una subroutine denominata **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** nel file Global. asax dell'applicazione ASP.NET.</xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate>

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule.Authenticate> event is raised during the <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication.AuthenticateRequest> event.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
trans-unit.target: Il <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule>costruisce una <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs>utilizzando l'identità di Windows fornita da IIS e corrente dell'oggetto <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>e lo passa al **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** evento.</xref:System.Web.HttpContext> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule>

trans-unit.source: You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object supplied to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.
trans-unit.target: È possibile utilizzare il <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A>proprietà del <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs>oggetto fornito per il **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** evento per impostare il <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A>proprietà dell'oggetto corrente <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>su un oggetto personalizzato <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal>oggetto.</xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> </xref:System.Web.HttpContext> </xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A>

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property during the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the Windows identity supplied by IIS is used as the identity for the current request.
trans-unit.target: Se non si specifica un valore per il <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A>proprietà durante il **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** evento, l'identità fornita da IIS viene utilizzato come identità per la richiesta corrente di Windows.</xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A>

trans-unit.source: If IIS uses anonymous authentication, then the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Se IIS utilizza l'autenticazione anonima, la <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A>proprietà del <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs>oggetto viene impostato per l'identità restituita dal <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A>metodo.</xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> </xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A>

trans-unit.source: The **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is only raised when the authentication <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode> and the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> is an active HTTP module for the application.
trans-unit.target: Il **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** è solo l'evento generato quando l'autenticazione <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A>è impostato su <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode>e <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule>è un modulo HTTP attivo per l'applicazione.</xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> </xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode> </xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A>
